info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 10:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brunswick and southeastern Columbus Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1014 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little River Entrance, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oak Island, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Ocean Crest Pier, Yaupon Beach, Iredell, St. James, Carolina Shores, Calabash, Makatoka, Civie Town, Supply, Exum, Longwood, Seaside, Brunswick County Community College Main Campus, Ash and Grissettown. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
